skill.name: frontend-orchestrator
skill.description: Coordinates frontend development tasks (React, TypeScript, UI/UX). Use when implementing user interfaces, components, state management, or visual features. Applies frontend-standard.md for quality gates.
skill.summary: Manages frontend development workflows for React applications including component orchestration, state management, accessibility validation, and visual testing coordination.
skill.author: Brownbull

security_audit.summary: Static analysis detected patterns in documentation and metadata that triggered false positives. The skill is a coordination layer for frontend development tasks with no actual execution of network calls, file operations, or shell commands. All flagged findings are benign documentation artifacts and hash values used for integrity verification.

medium_findings.title: Documentation contains backtick patterns
medium_findings.description: The skill documentation uses backtick characters in YAML/JSON code examples and ASCII directory tree visualizations. Static analysis flagged these as shell command execution patterns. These are documentation artifacts, not executable code.

low_findings.title: Hash values in metadata flagged by scanner
low_findings.description: SHA256 hash strings used for content and tree integrity verification were flagged as potential weak cryptographic algorithms. These are strong cryptographic hashes used for change detection, not actual cryptographic implementations.

content.value_statement: Frontend development projects often involve scattered responsibilities across components, state management, and testing. The Frontend Orchestrator skill acts as a centralized coordinator that manages component hierarchies, assigns tasks to specialized frontend skills, validates accessibility standards, and ensures design system compliance across the codebase.
actual_capabilities: Manages component hierarchies and tracks component relationships across the application
Coordinates task assignment to specialized frontend skills (React, state management, routing, testing)
Validates accessibility compliance against WCAG AA standards
Maintains design system consistency by enforcing component reuse patterns
Orchestrates visual testing workflows using Playwright for cross-browser validation
Monitors frontend task progress and broadcasts completion events to other orchestrators
limitations: Does not execute build commands or modify files directly; coordinates through other skills
Relies on external skills to implement specific frontend functionality
Cannot validate third-party API contracts without backend orchestrator cooperation
Does not generate new design system components from scratch

use_cases.title: Managing complex React component hierarchies
use_cases.description: When building large React applications with many interconnected components, the orchestrator tracks dependencies, ensures proper component composition, and maintains the component registry for consistent patterns.
use_cases.target_user: Full-stack developers working on React applications with complex UI requirements

use_cases.title: Enforcing accessibility standards across frontend tasks
use_cases.description: Before deploying new components or features, the orchestrator validates all changes against WCAG AA requirements, keyboard navigation standards, and screen reader compatibility guidelines.
use_cases.target_user: Development teams prioritizing accessibility compliance and inclusive design

use_cases.title: Coordinating multi-skill frontend implementations
use_cases.description: For features requiring React components, state management updates, and route changes, the orchestrator sequences tasks, passes context between skills, and validates combined results before marking work complete.
use_cases.target_user: Teams using Claude Code with multiple specialized frontend skills for efficient development

prompt_templates.title: Create a new React component
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to create a {component_name} component at {location}. It should {description}. Use the design system components {available_components}. Coordinate this through the react-component-skill and ensure accessibility validation passes.
prompt_templates.scenario: When you want to create a new React component with proper orchestration

prompt_templates.title: Update state management
prompt_templates.prompt: The {feature} feature needs state updates. Current state shape is {state_shape}. Available actions should include {actions}. Delegate to state-management-skill with proper immutability patterns.
prompt_templates.scenario: When modifying Redux, Context, or other state management implementations

prompt_templates.title: Validate component accessibility
prompt_templates.prompt: Run accessibility validation on the {component_name} component at {location}. Check WCAG AA compliance, keyboard navigation, and screen reader compatibility. Report any violations found.
prompt_templates.scenario: When verifying that existing components meet accessibility standards

prompt_templates.title: Coordinate multi-step frontend feature
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement the {feature_name} feature which requires: (1) React components at {components_location}, (2) state management updates for {state_scope}, (3) route configuration at {route_path}. Orchestrate through appropriate skills and validate all checks pass.
prompt_templates.scenario: When implementing features that span multiple frontend subsystems

output_examples.input: Create a LoginForm component with email and password fields
output: âœ“ Loaded current frontend context from ai-state/active/frontend/
âœ“ Identified available design system components: Button, Input, Card
âœ“ Assigned task to react-component-skill with context package
âœ“ TypeScript types defined, props documented
âœ“ Accessibility validation: keyboard navigable, labels present
âœ“ Visual tests passed for all viewport sizes

output_examples.input: Update auth state to include user preferences
output: âœ“ Current state shape loaded from state.json
âœ“ Assigned to state-management-skill with immutability requirements
âœ“ New state shape: auth: { user, token, loading, preferences }
âœ“ Serializable actions: login, logout, refresh, updatePreferences
âœ“ Component usage updated where auth state is consumed

best_practices: Provide the component location, design system references, and any existing state context when requesting new frontend work
Include accessibility requirements explicitly in prompts when WCAG compliance is critical
Use the orchestrator for multi-step features that span components, state, and routes to ensure coordinated implementation
Check the ai-state/active/frontend/ context before requesting changes to understand current component relationships
anti_patterns: Requesting direct file modifications instead of using the orchestration workflow
Skipping accessibility validation for features requiring keyboard navigation or screen reader support
Creating new components without checking the design system for reusable alternatives
Modifying state management without understanding the full state shape and dependent components

faq.question: What frontend skills does this orchestrator coordinate?
faq.answer: The Frontend Orchestrator coordinates specialized skills including react-component-skill for component creation, state-management-skill for Redux/Context updates, route-config-skill for React Router changes, ui-test-skill for Playwright visual tests, and style-skill for Tailwind/CSS updates.

faq.question: Does this skill modify files directly?
faq.answer: No. The orchestrator acts as a coordination layer that assigns tasks to specialized skills. It prepares context packages, monitors execution, validates results, and broadcasts events but does not directly modify source files.

faq.question: How does accessibility validation work?
faq.answer: The orchestrator ensures all component tasks include WCAG AA compliance checks. This covers keyboard navigation, proper ARIA labels, sufficient color contrast, and screen reader compatibility. Failed validations block completion.

faq.question: Can I use this for non-React frameworks?
faq.answer: The skill is optimized for React and TypeScript workflows. It references React-specific patterns like component hierarchies, React Router, and React state management. Other frameworks may require different orchestration approaches.

faq.question: How does this integrate with backend development?
faq.answer: The Frontend Orchestrator communicates with the Backend Orchestrator for API contract negotiation, error format agreement, and loading state coordination. It listens for backend.api.updated events and broadcasts frontend.component.created events.

faq.question: What validation checks are enforced?
faq.answer: Required checks include TypeScript compilation, unit test coverage, visual regression tests, accessibility audits, responsive layout validation, and design system compliance. All checks must pass before a task is marked complete.
